parameters.content:
## Overview
Auto-translate YouTube uploads to Japanese and post to Slack (DeepL + Slack)

## Whoâ€™s it for
Marketing or community teams that follow English-speaking creators but share updates with Japanese audiences; language learners who want JP summaries of newly released videos; internal comms teams curating industry channels for a JP workspace.

## What it does
This workflow detects new YouTube uploads, retrieves full metadata, translates the title and description into Japanese using DeepL, and posts a formatted message to a Slack channel. It also skips non-English titles to avoid unnecessary translation.
## How it works
ãƒ»RSS watches a channel for new items.
ãƒ»YouTube API fetches the full snippet (title/description).
ãƒ»Text is combined into a single payload and sent to DeepL.
ãƒ»The translated result + original metadata is merged and posted to Slack.

## Requirements
ãƒ»YouTube OAuth (for reliable snippet retrieval)
ãƒ»DeepL API key (Free or Pro)
ãƒ»Slack OAuth

## How to set up
ãƒ»Duplicate this template.
ãƒ»Open the Config (Set) node and fill in YT_CHANNEL_ID, TARGET_LANG, SLACK_CHANNEL.
ãƒ»Connect credentials for YouTube, DeepL, and Slack (donâ€™t hardcode API keys in HTTP nodes).
ãƒ»Click Execute workflow and verify one sample post.

## How to customize
ãƒ»Change TARGET_LANG to any language supported by DeepL.
ãƒ»Add filters (exclude Shorts, skip videos under N characters).
ãƒ»Switch to Slack Blocks for richer formatting or thread replies.
ãƒ»Add a fallback translator or retry logic on HTTP errors.
## Notes & limits
DeepL Free/Pro have different endpoints/quotas and monthly character limits. YouTube and Slack also enforce rate limits. Keep credentials in n8nâ€™s credential store; do not commit keys into templates. Rotate keys if you accidentally exposed them.

## Send a Message (Skipped)
ğŸ“˜ Setup Steps
1ï¸âƒ£ Connect YouTube, DeepL, and Slack credentials
2ï¸âƒ£ Update the RSS channel ID
3ï¸âƒ£ Adjust Slack channel name if needed
4ï¸âƒ£ Test with one video manually

(Optional) Embed a quick Loom video for reviewers.

## Format YouTube Data for DeepL

ğŸ§  Prepare Translation Input
Combines YouTube data into a single formatted text:
ã€Titleã€‘
{title}

ã€Descriptionã€‘
{description}

## Language Filter
ğŸ” Filter English Titles Only
Skips non-English titles based on regex (^[A-Za-z0-9\\s\\W]+$).
If true â†’ proceed to translation.
If false â†’ send â€œskippedâ€ message to Slack.

## RSS Trigger

â° Trigger for new uploads
Checks the target YouTube channel RSS feed for new video posts.
Automatically passes new entries to the next node.

## Merge

ğŸ”— Combine Original + Translated Data
Joins DeepL translation results with YouTube metadata.
Output: unified object ready for Slack posting.

## Translate with DeepL

ğŸŒ Translate text into Japanese
Uses the DeepL API (POST request).
Translates the combined YouTube text.
Returns JSON with translated output.
âš ï¸ Never hardcode API keys â€” store in credentials.

## Get a Video
ğŸ¬ Retrieve Full Video Details
Uses the YouTube API to fetch snippet information such as title and description.
Input: video ID from RSS.
Output: structured JSON for downstream processing.

## Setup checklist
1) Connect: YouTube OAuth / DeepL / Slack
2) Open â€œSet (Config)â€ and fill: YT_CHANNEL_ID, TARGET_LANG, SLACK_CHANNEL
3) Replace DeepL HTTP node with DeepL credential (no hardcoded key)
4) Run once with a recent video to validate
5) Optional: turn on Error Trigger â†’ Slack #alerts

## Send to Slack
ğŸ’¬ Post Translated Message to Slack
Sends formatted message to a selected channel.
Includes both translated and original texts with a video link.
Example output:

##  Format Translated Output

This Code node formats the DeepL translation result into a clean JSON object 
that can be sent to Slack or other integrations.
Input:
- Translated text (from DeepL)
- Original title and description
Output:
{
  "translated_title": "...",
  "translated_description": "...",
  "original_title": "...",
  "url": "..."
}

Tip:
If you modify the Slack message format, adjust field names here.
